excellent.overallSummary: Your financial health is excellent! Strong savings and debt management are your foundation.

factorInsights.name: Savings Rate
factorInsights.suggestion: Keep up this great habit and consider automating your savings.

factorInsights.name: Budget Planning
factorInsights.explanation: Your budgets are helping you stay on track.
factorInsights.suggestion: Review and adjust your budgets quarterly as life changes.

factorInsights.name: Debt Management

factorInsights.suggestion: Stay debt-free by living within your means.

factorInsights.explanation: You have a solid financial cushion.
factorInsights.suggestion: Maintain your emergency fund and invest any excess.

good.overallSummary: Solid financial foundation. Focus on building your emergency fund and increasing savings rate.

factorInsights.name: Savings Rate
factorInsights.explanation: You're saving regularly, which is great.
factorInsights.suggestion: Try to increase your savings rate to 20% or more.

factorInsights.name: Budget Planning
factorInsights.explanation: Your budgets are working for you.
factorInsights.suggestion: Track spending in all major categories for better control.

factorInsights.name: Debt Management
factorInsights.suggestion: Focus on paying down high-interest debt first.

factorInsights.name: Emergency Fund
factorInsights.suggestion: Aim for 3-6 months of expenses in emergency savings.

top3Recommendations: Build emergency fund to 3 months expenses
Review and optimize your budget categories

fair.overallSummary: Room for improvement. Prioritize building emergency savings and creating a consistent budget.

factorInsights.name: Savings Rate
factorInsights.suggestion: Start with saving just 10% of your income automatically.

factorInsights.name: Budget Planning
factorInsights.explanation: You need more structure in your spending.
factorInsights.suggestion: Create at least 3 budget categories to start tracking.

factorInsights.name: Debt Management
factorInsights.explanation: Debt is affecting your financial health.
factorInsights.suggestion: List all debts and create a payoff plan starting with smallest.

factorInsights.name: Emergency Fund
factorInsights.suggestion: Save $500 for emergencies before focusing on other goals.

top3Recommendations: Set up automatic savings of 10% monthly
Create a basic budget with 3-5 categories

needs_improvement.overallSummary: Time to build better habits. Start with small wins: track spending and save $100 this month.

factorInsights.name: Savings Rate
factorInsights.suggestion: Start small: save $50 this week, even if it's just $10 daily.

factorInsights.name: Budget Planning
factorInsights.explanation: You need to start tracking your money.
factorInsights.suggestion: Write down every expense for one week to see patterns.

factorInsights.name: Debt Management
factorInsights.explanation: Debt is a major concern right now.
factorInsights.suggestion: Stop adding new debt and call creditors to discuss options.

factorInsights.name: Emergency Fund
factorInsights.explanation: You have no safety net for emergencies.
factorInsights.suggestion: Save $25 this week in a separate account for emergencies only.

top3Recommendations: List all debts and minimum payments
